item.title: Data Literacy
item.description: Intro Data is fundamentally different from information, and information is fundamentally different from knowledge. However, they are related in the sense that knowledge is composed of collected information and information is composed of curated and analyzed data. Since data science is defined as the process of extracting value from data, and whatâ€™s valuable is knowledge, we can look at data science as the process of turning data into accurate information, and then into knowledge/insight.
